title: Why Consumer Bargain Hunting Is Reshaping December Demand Patterns
highlights: Visible, time-limited offers front-load visits; easiest demand to steal before competitors match prices [^9].
Deeper blanket discounts lift traffic but cut real margin and long run pricing power; prefer limited-circulation collabs to protect base price [^4].
In-store events plus QR-timed coupons convert visits into measurable redemptions; aim for QR redemption floor of ** ** of footfall.

This matters because a targeted early window can deliver **10-15%** base foot-traffic uplift (stretch **5%**), and raise early-window share from the current **12-15%** toward **20-30%** while keeping event CPA at or below ** ** and aiming for QR redemption floor ** ** of footfall, so test visible, co-branded limited SKUs and timed store events rather than deeper permanent markdowns to preserve pricing power [^9] [^4].
